radiographic_examinations.findings: Expanding, ground glass lesion involving the left mandible from parasymphysis to condyle, containing a central lytic area; associated periosteal reaction and diffuse inflammation involving the masseter and overlying soft tissues.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: There was initial reduction in mandibular lesion thickness and sclerosis confirmed by follow-up CT scan, without new lytic lesions or periosteal reaction.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Additional lesions in the right acetabulum, proximal left tibial metaphysis and bilateral distal tibia.
Right mandible ground-glass lesion with areas of sclerosis and osteolysis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Marked improvement in the size of the mandibular lesion was demonstrated in follow-up CT scans.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Dramatic improvement in right mandible with minimal cortical thickening and decreased bone expansion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The improvement remained stable clinically and radiologically almost 3 years later.
